text:
One last question on data types:
• data types: string, integer, float, boolean
• data types: list, dictionary, tuples, sets
• data types: array?, df?
Are these all data types or called somehow different?

data types: list, dictionary, tuples, sets, array?, df?

datatypes

text: <@U01RN7BVD1C>, (numpy) arrays and (pandas) dataframes are also datatypes, but not python-built in. They're borrowed from other modules/packages

text:
Ok, then sorry I got it wrong.

<@U01SJKB2MG8> what are data structures then?

user_profile.real_name: Thanh Tung Ha Thuc DAFT Berlin March 2021
user_profile.name: tony.hathuc

elements.text: Ok, then sorry I got it wrong.
what are data structures then?

text:
the takeaway is basically that e.g. a pandas dataframe is built out of
• a series datatype
    ◦ which in turn is built on numpy (arrays)
        ▪︎ which again makes use of python fundamental datatypes
• an index datatype
so you have datatyp "encapsulation"

elements.text: the takeaway is basically that e.g. a pandas dataframe is built out of
a series datatype
which in turn is built on numpy (arrays)
which again makes use of python fundamental datatypes
an index datatype
so you have datatyp "encapsulation"

text: <@U01RXCQHMHT>, sometimes the collection datatypes like sets, lists, dictionaries etc. are also called datastructures

elements.text: , sometimes the collection datatypes like sets, lists, dictionaries etc. are also called datastructures
